CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, November 8, 1952, pg. 21 reads: "At Potentate's Ball - Noble Washington Russell and his daughter, Ices, spent a delightful evening at the Potentate's banquet given by the Shriners at Fort Pitt Hotel in beautiful English Room. Noble Russell rose to his present position step by step.  He was raised to the degree of Master Mason in the Rising Star Lodge 667 F. & A.M. Prince Hall affiliation in 1922 at Ford City; received the Royal Arch degree in Victory Chapter 38 at Pittsburgh in 1924; the Knights Templar degree in Allies Commandery in the same city in 1926; was created Sublime Prince of Royal Secret in St. Cyprian Consistory 4, S.P.R.S., at Pittsburgh ,and was made a Noble in the Imperial Council of the Ancient Egyptian-Arabic Order of Nobles of the Mystic Shrine of North and South America and its Jurisdictions, Inc., in Sahara Temple 2, the Desert of Pennsylvania, city of Pittsburgh.-Harris Photo." Cutline of related image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, November 8, 1952, pg. 14 reads: "Notables at Potentate's Banquet- When Sahara Temple 2, of the Ancient Egyptian Arabic Order of Nobles of the Mystic Shrine held its annual "Potentates' Ball and Reception" in the English Room of the Fort Pitt Hotel last Friday...Harris Photo"
TitMainTitle: Ices Russell, wearing light colored lace gown, crocheted shawl, and fez, and father Washington Russell wearing tuxedo with tails and Sahara Temple fez, standing in Fort Pitt Hotel with marble walls and male figurative sculpture, for Shriners Potentate's ball
